champ.champInfo:
The direct holding of the competition is entrusted to KDYUSSH KOZAK


Organizing committee and judges:

  • Chief judge of the competition — Sergey Bronistovsky, 6th Dan, Kyiv
  • Organizational issues — Oleksandr Sushko, 2nd Dan (Kyiv), +38-050-843-06-24
  • Technical support — Igor Tatarchenko (Lviv), +38-067-788-77-28

Venue of the competition: Kyiv, str. Princely backwater of the 17th century

The competition will be held in Kyiv on March 16, 2024

Competition program

March 16 (Saturday):

  • 08:00 - 09:00 team registration
  • 09:00 - 09:30 judges' seminar in the "kumite" section, judges' meeting, formation of teams
  • 09:30 - 12:00 start of competition in the "kumite" section
  • 12:00 - 12:30 ceremonial opening of the competition (parade of participants of all sections of the competition)
  • 12:40 - 17:00 final part of the competition
  • 17:00 - 18:00 awarding of winners and prize-winners of all sections of the competition, closing of the competition

Competition rules.

  • Competitions (individual) are held separately for female participants in the kumite section in the Olympic style
  • If, based on previous applications, there is an insufficient number of participants for high-quality holding of competitions in certain categories, the Organizing Committee may make the following changes to the Regulations for these competitions:
    • combine bordering weight categories (only with the coach's consent)
    • hold competitions in specified weight categories in a round-robin fashion
  • Competitions are held separately for male and female participants
  • Categories consist of no more than 4 participants
  • Competitions are held according to the Olympic system with a match for 3rd place

Categories of participants:
series A (8 kyu and above)
series B (0 - 9 kyu)

Kumite series A and series B separately:

2020-2020 Boys/Girls -20 -25 -30 +30 1 min., 1 min., 2 kg., 1 min.

Competition conditions

Competitions are held in accordance with the "Kyokushinkai Karate Competition Rules" in force in Ukraine

Financing

Expenses for organizing competitions (awarding winners and prize-winners, renting sports equipment buildings and auxiliary premises, competition headquarters and office equipment, rent of tatami mats, payment stationery, medicines, medical and service personnel, printing posters and others paraphernalia for competitions, preparation of competition venues, placement of advertisements, transport and other expenses on the organization of competitions) are carried out at the expense of KDYUSSH KOZAK

Awards

  • 1st place - diploma, medal, cup
  • 2nd place - diploma, medal
  • 3rd place - diploma, medal
  • 4th place - diploma, medal

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until March 10, 2024.
